Filing any other initiating document (as defined in regulation 4), unless a different filing fee is prescribed for that document elsewhere in the fees table

Filing an exempt interlocutory application (as defined in regulation 4)

application without notice
application on notice relating to a proceeding to which item 2, 3, 46, or 48 applies
any other application on notice

disbursements.label: Statements of defence and other documents in response

items.label: Filing a statement of defence,—
if included in the same document as a counterclaim, and providing that the fee for filing a counterclaim is paid (see item 13)
in any other case
Filing a statement of defence between defendants
Filing an amended statement of defence
Filing a counterclaim (which may include in the same document, for no additional fee, a statement of defence) for—
a proceeding to which item 2 or 3 applies
any other proceeding
Filing a notice of opposition,—
in the case of a notice of opposition against an exempt application or an exempt interlocutory application
in the case of a notice of opposition against an interlocutory application for summary judgment
in any other case (unless a different filing fee is prescribed for that notice of opposition elsewhere in the fees table—see item 49)
Filing an appearance (HCR 5.49, 5.50, 5.51)
Filing a third or subsequent party notice
For scheduling the hearing date for an application or proceeding,—
in the case of an exempt application
in the case of an interlocutory application
in the case of an application or proceeding to which item 2, 3, or 48 applies
in any other case
Hearing an exempt application or an exempt interlocutory application
Hearing an application or proceeding to which item 2, 3, or 48 applies, for each half-day or part half-day after the first half-day
Hearing any other application or proceeding, for each half-day or part half-day after the first half-day
Judicial settlement conference

Issuing a charging order without leave (HCR 17.42)

Filing any of the following:an application in common form for probate or letters of administration:an application relating to a deceased person’s estate made prior or subsequent to a grant of administration:an application for an order that is made under section 14 or 31, or for the purpose of section 18, of the Wills Act 2007
Sealing a grant of administration obtained by way of an application under HCR 27.4 or 27.6
Sealing an exemplification of administration (HCR 27.33(1))
Sealing a duplicate of a grant of administration (HCR 27.33(2)﻿(a))
Sealing and certifying a copy or photocopy of a grant of administration (HCR 27.33(2)﻿(b))
Issuing a certificate of administration under section 18 of the Administration Act 1969
Resealing, under section 71 of the Administration Act 1969, probate or letters of administration granted by an overseas court
Filing an election to administer under Part 6 of the Public Trust Act 2001, Part 3 of the Trustee Companies Act 1967, or section 12A or 12B of the Māori Trustee Act 1953
Issuing a certified copy of an election to administer filed under Part 6 of the Public Trust Act 2001, Part 3 of the Trustee Companies Act 1967, or section 12A or 12B of the Māori Trustee Act 1953

Searching or inspecting a document or a court file that relates to an application or action for a grant of administration under the Administration Act 1969 or to a proceeding for the recall of any such grant (HCR 3.7(2)),—
if a fee has been paid under item 55 to search or inspect the formal court record in relation to the grant
in any other case
Supplying a copy of a will,—
if a fee has been paid under item 44 in respect of the will
in any other case
Filing a request for issue of a bankruptcy notice (HCR 24.8)
[Revoked]
Filing a creditor’s application for adjudication (HCR 24.11)
Filing a notice of opposition to application for adjudication (HCR 24.18)
Sealing an order for bankruptcy
Sealing the original copy of any judgment (HCR 11.11), order (other than an order to which item 60 applies), or letter of request (HCR 9.26)
Issuing a certified copy of—
any document that is part of the formal court record or on the court file
any Registrar’s certificate
Copying any document (other than a judgment),—
for the first copy of any part or parts of the court file or any document relating to the proceeding that is provided to a party to the proceeding or that party's counsel
if a fee under item 44 has been paid to search or inspect the document, or the court file containing the document
where paragraphs (a) and (b) do not apply,—
for each black and white page
for each colour page
for documents in electronic form
Copying a judgment,—
for the first copy that is provided to a party to the proceeding or that party's counsel
where paragraph (a) does not apply
Searching or inspecting the formal court record (HCR 3.7(1),—
for the first name or case searched
for each additional name or case searched
Requesting access to a document or court file as follows:
if the request is made by a party to a proceeding or that party's counsel (HCR 3.8) in respect of a document or court file relating to the proceeding
if a fee has been paid under item 55(a) in respect of the court file or the formal court record
in any other case
Attendance before a Registrar in an inquiry or reference
Examination of witnesses by a Registrar under an order of the court
Filing an application for admission as a barrister and solicitor under section 57 of the Lawyers and Conveyancers Act 2006
Sealing an order for admission as a barrister and solicitor
Issuing a certified copy of an order for admission as a barrister and solicitor
Issuing a certificate of enrolment on the roll of barristers and solicitors kept under the Lawyers and Conveyancers Act 2006
Filing an application for registration, in respect of admission as a barrister and solicitor, under section 19 of the Trans-Tasman Mutual Recognition Act 1997
Issuing a Registrar’s certificate following notice under section 19 of the Trans-Tasman Mutual Recognition Act 1997
Filing an application under section 56 of the Trans-Tasman Proceedings Act 2010 to register in the court under subpart 5 of Part 2 of that Act a registrable Australian judgment
Filing either of the following applications:
an application to set aside registration of an Australian judgment (under section 61 of the Trans-Tasman Proceedings Act 2010):
an application for a stay of enforcement of a registered Australian judgment (under section 65 of the Trans-Tasman Proceedings Act 2010)
Filing an application to enforce a judgment for rates under section 67 of the Local Government (Rating) Act 2002
Selling or leasing a rating unit under section 70 of the Local Government (Rating) Act 2002

Application for Registrar to conduct a sale for a vendor mortgagee under section 187 of the Property Law Act 2007Note: For the minimum and maximum commission that is payable, if the land is sold, by the vendor mortgagee to the Registrar under section 194(1)﻿(c) of that Act, see regulation 8
Filing an application for the issue of a warrant of arrest (of property) (HCR 25.34)
Filing a request for a commission for the appraisement and sale of any property (HCR 25.51)
Selling property under a commission for sale (HCR 25.51)
